discussion.content:
Well this is for the disscusion, since it offloads central computation
 as well.

comments.content: But it doesn't completely "remove the need"..

choices.C: It simplifies security as devices and processing are brought closer together.
choices.B: It reduces data velocity from devices or other data sources.
choices.D: It removes the need for centralized data processing.
choices.A: It reduces network latency by moving processing closer to the data source.

questions.question_text: What is the benefit of edge computing?

comments.content: What is the point of repeating the suggested answer?

discussion.content:
pay consume
shared internet
self-service
overflow
low-latency

Public cloud: environment where you pay only for the resources that you consume / shared compute platform that is offered over the internet 
Private cloud: offers a self-service, elastic compute environment from a dedicated set of physical resources 
Hybrid cloud: provides an approach for overflow traffic to burst out to meet peak demands 
Edge computing: provides a low-latency compute capability close to the data source

Drag and drop the descriptions from the left onto the correct application deployment models on the right.

//IMG//
Which type of threat occurs when an attacker can send hostile data to an interpreter within an application?

discussion.content: D is correct per OWASP: "Injection flaws occur when an attacker can send hostile data to an interpreter."
Is it this? - Hostile data is used within ORM search parameters to extract additional sensitive records.

questions.question_text: A company is looking for a cloud deployment which will only use the on-premise infrastructure, is user self-service, and is easy to scale. Which cloud solution should be selected for these requirements?

discussion.content: B is right, but question is badly worded. Private cloud is NOT easy to scale.

comments.content: Agree. Answer is B. and other key words from questions are:' only use the on-premise infrastructure'

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The only one that uses only onprem is Private
